content.question: Which of the following is most likely to be true about the reaction between <math alttext="S O 2, gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mi>S</mi><msub><mrow><mi>O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mstyle><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="O 3, gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><msub><mrow><mi>O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mstyle><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> at <math alttext="298 kelvin" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>298</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">K</mi></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="delta G naught, is less than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>G</mi><mi>°</mi><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn></math> and <math alttext="T delta S naught" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mi>T</mi></mstyle><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>∘</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is smaller in magnitude than <math alttext="delta H naught" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msup><mrow><mi>H</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>∘</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="delta G naught, is less than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>G</mi><mi>°</mi><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn></math> and <math alttext="T delta S naught" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow></mstyle><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msup><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>∘</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> is larger in magnitude than <math alttext="delta H naught" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msup><mrow><mi>H</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>∘</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="delta G naught, is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>G</mi><mi>°</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></math> and <math alttext="T delta S naught" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow></mstyle><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msup><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>∘</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> is smaller in magnitude than <math alttext="delta H naught" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msup><mrow><mi>H</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>∘</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="delta G naught, is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>G</mi><mi>°</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></math> and <math alttext="T delta S naught" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow></mstyle><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msup><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>∘</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> is larger in magnitude than <math alttext="delta H naught" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msup><mrow><mi>H</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>∘</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: <math alttext="delta G naught, is less than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>G</mi><mi>°</mi><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn></math> and <math alttext="T delta S naught" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mi>T</mi></mstyle><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>∘</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is smaller in magnitude than <math alttext="delta H naught" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msup><mrow><mi>H</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>∘</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>.

topic.text: 9.3: Gibbs Free Energy and Thermodynamic Favorability

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
